name: Titanium.UI.Clipboard
summary: A module used for accessing clipboard data.

methods.name: clearData
methods.summary: Deletes data of the specified MIME type stored in the clipboard. If MIME type omitted, all data is deleted.

methods.name: clearText
methods.summary: Deletes all text data stored in the clipboard.
methods.description: This method deletes any data saved using the setText method, or that has a text or text/plain MIME type.

methods.name: getData
methods.summary: Gets data of the specified MIME type stored in the clipboard.

parameters.name: type
parameters.summary: MIME type. Must be text type on Android.

methods.name: getItems
methods.summary: Gets the items that have been specified earlier using setItems.

methods.name: getText
methods.summary: Gets text data stored in the clipboard.

methods.name: hasColors
methods.summary: Indicates whether any colors are stored in the clipboard.

methods.name: hasData
methods.summary: Indicates whether any data of the specified MIME type is stored in the clipboard.

parameters.name: type
parameters.summary: MIME type. Must be text type on Android.

methods.name: hasImages
methods.summary: Indicates whether any images are stored in the clipboard.

methods.name: hasText
methods.summary: Indicates whether any text data is stored in the clipboard.

methods.name: hasURLs
methods.summary: Indicates whether any URLs are stored in the clipboard.

methods.name: setData
methods.summary: Stores data of the specified MIME type in the clipboard.
methods.description:
This method will overwrite any existing data for the specified MIME type.

Note that the clipboard is intended to store only one item of data at a time. This method enables different representations/formats of a data item to be saved.

parameters.name: type
parameters.summary: MIME type. Must be text type on Android.

methods.name: setItems
methods.summary: Adds an array of items to a clipboard, and sets privacy options for all included items.
methods.description: You can pass multiple options to the options object. Note that this API is mime-type based. The key must be a valid mime-type and the value must be the value that matches the given mime-type. If no valid mime-type is provided a a key, receiving items with getItems will crash the app. See the below example for more information on the usage.

parameters.name: items
parameters.summary:
An array of key-value items to add to the clipboard. The key must a valid mime-type
matching the mime-type of the value.

methods.name: setText
methods.description: This method will overwrite any existing text data.

properties.name: allowCreation
properties.summary: Create a clipboard identified by name if it doesn't exist.
properties.description: If "create" is false, it will return the existing named clipboard but will not create new one. If "create" is true, it will return the existing clipboard (if exists). Otherwise it will create new clipboard with given name.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Create a new clipboard with a given name. See the example on how to use this.

properties.name: unique
properties.summary: Create a new clipboard identified by a unique system-generated name.
properties.description: Create a new clipboard identified by a unique system-generated name. See the example on how to use this.
